page.title: 09Changing Industry in Felsted
page.content: The British Sugar Corporation factory in Felsted opened in 1926 as a processing unit employing 290 people. In February 1981 the processing unit was closed for economic reasons - the factory being old needed an enormous amount of money spent on it to modernise it and to make it much more efficient and this was not considered practical. Since 1981 the factory has been used purely as a warehouse and distribution centre employing 26 people mainly from the Felsted area. Closing the processing unit did not affect the local farmers too much as their main crops are wheat, barley and oilseed rape, but of course it did have an effect on employment locally. The British Sugar Corporation have no plans, for the immediate future, which concern the factory in Felsted.
